## Chapter 1  Letter to Shareholders

Dear shareholders,

Influenced by COVID-19 in 2020, China, known as a global manufacturing power, was first in lockdown, and then other countries were also affected, resulting into a slowdown in global economic development. The IMF released at the beginning of this year that the global economic growth shrank 3.5 percent last year. Although  there  is  still  no  significant  downward  trend  of  the  epidemic,  with  the  development  and popularization  of  vaccines,  it  should  be  effectively  controlled  and  relieved.  It  is  predicted  that  global economic activity will return to the pre-epidemic level this year. In the face of the impact of the epidemic, AcBel Polytech Inc. picked up the pace of development. Although it was greatly affected at the beginning of 2020, thanks to communication with external stakeholders and rapid internal adjustment, the Company gradually regained its footing in the second half of the year and achieved growth in revenue and profit for the  whole  year.  We  hereby  report  to  our  shareholders  the  annual  operating  results  for  2020  and  the operating prospect for 2021.

## 2020 Operating Results

The revenue for the whole year reached NT$20.983 billion, 1.94 percent up from the previous year. Net profit after tax was also boosted by the sale of land to NT$1.313 billion. Earnings per share after tax was NT$2.54.

AcBel Electronic (Wuhan) was closed down by COVID-19 at the beginning of the year. In the first wave of the epidemic,  it  quickly  developed  countermeasures,  including  personnel  protection,  personnel management, supply chain investigation, customer communication, to strengthen its own conditions. The epidemic has changed some patterns of industry and the transfer of the end market, such as home office, teleconferences and other opportunities, which also drive the shipments of laptops, servers, and memory. In 2020, AcBel obtained the bidding project of a total of 316,000 meters. So far, it has shipped nearly 400,000 meters.  It  will  continue  to  develop  technologies  and  capabilities  in  the  field  of  smart  grids  in  line  with policies.  In  terms  of  green  energy  layout,  the  Company  also  achieved  great  results,  with  the  cumulative amount of solar power generation field reaching 137MWp, of which 36MWp has been completed. In terms of  electric  vehicle-related  products,  the  Company  has  co-developed  motor  drivers  with  leading  large manufacturers, and also cooperated with well-known electric vehicle manufacturers to cut into the power management system of power switching plant, thus becoming a comprehensive integrated power service platform.

AcBel has also been recognized for its efforts in corporate governance and corporate social responsibility. We  have  won  the  Taiwan  Corporate  Sustainability  Report  Awards  -  Platinum  Award  for  Electronic Information Manufacturing, Excellent Enterprise - Innovation and Growth Award, Excellent Enterprise Climate Change Award in the "2020 TCSA Taiwan Corporate Sustainability Award", and become the first to  pass  the  TCFD  Maturity  Model  Verification  [Excellent  -  Highest  Level]  in  the  global  electronics industry,  demonstrating  our  commitment  to  giving  back  to  the  community  and  implementing  corporate social responsibility.

## Business Environment and Development Strategies

AcBel upholds the commitment of " We Power the World with Sustainable/Renewable Energy and High Efficiency Power Supply ", will take its own research and development efficiency as the core in the future, join  the  concept  of  providing  positive  energy  of  the  earth,  and  strive  to  create  the  maximum  value  for customers,  employees  and  shareholders.  In  combination  of  strong  R&D  momentum,  we  step  into  the application of the areas of clean energy, solar power plant, medical equipment and electric vehicle related power products, with a view to become the innovative leading company of smart green energy in the power industry.

## 2021 Operating Prospect

It  is  expected  that  the  performance  of  consumer  power  supply  will  continue  to  grow,  the  market  for terminal applications such as smart home, e-sports, IoT, and monitoring systems will expand increasingly, the industrial power supply will grow rapidly due to 5G application cloud data center, artificial intelligence, big data application and popularization of electric vehicles, which will greatly drive the market size and customer order demand. The Company's sales of power supply products are expected to be 77,637 units this year. In the fuel cell power supply sector, as the global market share of key international customers increases, AcBel plans to expand its production capacity in Taiwan to drive its performance of the hardware power supply products to increase year by year. At present, in addition to power supply products, we are also  engaged  in  power  supply  system  integration  and  assembly  business,  so  as  to  improve  the  overall shipment margin and revenue scale.

The construction of our new plant in Tamsui commenced in early January 2020, which is expected to be completed by the end of 2021 and to be officially put into operation in the first quarter of 2022. By then, the Company will fully introduce the intelligent production line, which is expected to contribute a capacity of 2.5 billion to increase revenue and profit. The old site will be demolished and rebuilt after the new plant comes online, which is expected to be put into mass production in the next 2~3 years.

Going forward, we will focus on the technological deepening of 5G communication, vehicle power supply, aerospace power supply, high-end consumer and medical power supply with forward-looking application technologies,  demonstrating  our  strong  ambition  and  constant  self-requirements  and  challenges  in forward-looking technology development.

Wish all shareholders.

Good health and good luck.

AcBel Polytech Inc.

Chairman: Hsu Sheng-Hsiung

Manager: Hsu Chieh-Li

Chief Accountant: Yeh Jin-Mao

## Chapter 2  Company Profile

Established  on  July  29,  1981,  AcBel  has  grown  into  one  of  the  world's  leading  suppliers  of  switching power supplies based on the sales business of domestic and international electronic parts from the early stage. Driven by global warming, all countries' response to the trend of energy conservation and carbon reduction  and  government  policies,  we  take  the  power  management  technology  as  our  core,  actively promote the application of green energy, step into the fields of electricity generation, power generation and power innovation, such as solar power plant, alternative energy, energy storage equipment, smart grid, etc. In  line  with  the  trend  of  the  electric  and  intelligent  industry,  we  have  invested  in  the  development  of electric  vehicles,  medical,  smart  home  equipment power supply and  other related products, and produce products of high quality and high efficiency, with low-cost energy saving and carbon reduction.

Power  supply  is  an  important  driving  force  for  all  electronic  products  and  equipment.  How  to  safely convert electricity into kinetic energy required by electronic products depends on the operation of a stable power supply. The manufacturing base of AcBel is concentrated in Taiwan, China and the Philippines in Asia.  In  response  to  customer  orders  and  industrial  changes,  we  expand  production  capacity  timely, promote  precise  manufacturing,  and  use  the  flexible  and  perfect  production  network  mode  to  meet  the needs of global brand customers. At the same time, we have set up service stations in the United States, Europe,  mainland China,  Japan  and  other  places,  so  as  to  provide  a  variety  of  nearby  services  close  to customer needs. With global R&D headquarters in Taiwan and professional R&D teams in mainland China, Malaysia and the United States, we grasp the market trends and meet customer needs for forward-looking technology research and product development, being ready to provide products with high efficiency and high quality on demand.

On March 20, 2020, the Board of Directors approved the retirement of the President, Mr. Kao Ching-Shang, and the Executive Vice President Mr. Hsu Chieh-Li was promoted to act as the President of the Company. Mr. Hsu Chieh-Li takes over as President, in addition to completing the handover task, he will also take advantage of his international vision, rich industrial experience and strong fighting capacity to lead the management team to plan for the future, strengthen the competitive advantage, and help AcBel move towards the sustainable operation.

The policies, systems, standards, and structure for the remuneration of the Independent Directors, and the correlation to the remuneration according to the responsibilities, risks time commitment and other factors:

The remuneration of the Company's Directors (including Independent Directors) shall be governed by Article 21 and Article 26 of the Articles of Incorporation.

When a Director (including an Independent Director) performs the business of the Company, the Company shall pay remuneration to him/her regardless of making profits or losses. The remuneration of all Directors shall, after review by the remuneration

committee, be submitted to the Board of Directors for resolution based on their participation in the operation of the Company and the value of their contributions, taking into account the normal rate adopted by other companies in the same industry. In addition,

if the Company makes profits for the year, the provision of remuneration to the Director as set forth in accordance with the Articles of Incorporation shall be submitted to the Board of Directors for resolution after deliberation by the remuneration committee.

- 2. Where  the  Company  has  had  an  insufficient  Director  shareholding  percentage  for  3  consecutive  months  or  longer during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration of individual Directors: None.
- 3. Where the Company has had an average ratio of share pledging by Directors in excess of 50 percent in any 3 months during the most recent fiscal year, it shall disclose the remuneration paid to each Director having a ratio of pledged shares in excess of 50 percent for each such month: None.
- 4. If the total amount of remuneration received by all of the Directors in their capacity as Directors of all of the companies listed  in  the  financial  reports  exceeds  2  percent  of  the  net  income  after  tax,  and  the  remuneration  received  by  any individual  Director  exceeds  NT$15  million,  the  Company  shall  disclose  the  remuneration  paid  to  that  individual Director or Supervisor: None.
- 5. If the Company is ranked in the lowest tier in the corporate governance evaluation for the most recent fiscal year, or in the most recent fiscal year or up to the date of publication of the financial report for that year, the Company's securities have been placed under an altered trading method, suspended from trading, delisted from the TWSE or the TPEx, or the Corporate Governance Evaluation Committee has resolved the Company shall be excluded from the evaluation: None.
- 6. If the average annual salary of the full-time non-supervisory employees in the Company is less than NT$500,000 in the most recent fiscal year: None.

-  According to the provisions of the Articles of Incorporation, if the Company makes profits for the year, it shall set aside no more than 2% of the pre-tax profits of the current period before the deduction of employee remuneration and Director remuneration as Directors' remuneration, and pay reasonable remuneration to Directors taking into account the operating results of the Company and their contribution to the Company's performance.

The Company also monitors the changes in the global economy, the international financial environment and the industrial climate at any time to predict the Company's future operation development, profit situation and operation risks, as well  as changes in relevant laws and regulations, and reviews the remuneration system on a timely basis to strike a balance between the Company's sustainable operation and risk control.

The  amended  Internal  Control  Systems  and  the  Implementation  Rules  for Internal  Audit  have  been  deliberated  by  the  audit  committee  and  have been  submitted  to  the 10th  Meeting  of  19th  Session  of  the  board  meeting  on  March  20,  2020  and  adopted  by resolution.

## Notes:

- ￭ Corporate Governance Organizational Structure
- The  Company  follows  the  Corporate  Governance  Best-Practice  Principles  for  TWSE/TPEx  Listed Companies, and the Reason for Such Variance as the basis for its corporate governance operations, complies  with  relevant  laws  and  regulations  in  handling  corporate  governance  and  internal management  mechanisms,  realizes  the  transparency  of  operational  and  financial  information  and focuses on shareholders' equity.

The  Board  of  Directors  is  the  Company's  highest  governance  unit  and  major  business decision-making center, is responsible for appointing and supervising the management level of the Company,  supervising  business  performance,  preventing  conflicts  of  interest,  ensuring  that  the Company  complies  with  laws  and  regulations  and  the  Articles  of  Incorporation,  or  that  the shareholders' meeting is able to exercise its functions and powers for resolutions, and is committed to maximizing the shareholders' equity. Through the Board of Directors, the Company strengthens the supervision  and  management  of  the  Company's  operations,  and  sets  up  an  audit  committee  and  a remuneration committee to facilitate the Board of Directors to perform relevant duties.

- ￭ Implementation of Diversity Policy of Board Members
- The Company's current Board of Directors is composed of 11 Directors, including three Independent Directors. The nomination and selection of the board members shall be conducted in accordance with the  provisions  of  the  Articles  of  Incorporation,  adopting  the  candidate  nomination  system,  in compliance  with  the  Election  Procedures  of  Directors  and  the  Corporate  Governance  Practice Principles, so as to ensure the diversity and independence of Directors.
- Except for the number of Directors who are concurrently managers of the Company shall not exceed one-third of all Directors, the composition of the Board of Directors shall be determined based on the Company's  business  operations,  operating  dynamics,  and  development  needs.The  policy  should include, without being limited to, the following two general standards:
- I. Basic requirements and values: Gender, age, nationality, and culture.
- II. Professional  knowledge  and  skills:  A  professional  background  (e.g.,  law,  accounting, operation,  investment  and  M&A,  risk  management),  professional  skills,  and  industry experience.

In  accordance  with  Chapter  3  of  the  Company's  Corporate  Governance  Practice  Principles  Strengthen  the  functions  of  the  Board  of  Directors,  each  board  member  shall  have  the  necessary knowledge, skill, and experience to perform their duties. In order to achieve the ideal objective of corporate governance, the abilities that must be present in the board as a whole are as follows:

- I. The ability to make judgments about operations.
- II. Accounting and financial analysis ability.
- III. Business management ability.
- IV. Crisis management ability.
- V. Knowledge of the industry.
- VI. An international market perspective.
- VII. Leadership ability.
- VIII. Decision-making ability.

The current board members of the Company all have relevant experience in the same industry and management  ability.  However,  in  order  to  ensure  the  sustainable  operation  of  the  Company,  the composition of the Board of Directors shall be mainly based on expertise and complementarity in each sector, followed by gender and age, and will be focused on the younger age and gender diversity in the future.

## ■ Rights and interests of employees and care for employees

Under  the  vision  of  "happy  enterprise",  our  mission  is  to  create  a  healthy  and  safe  working environment and a happy and growth and learning space for our employees. We treat and respect every employee fairly, and provide all statutory or even superior employee benefits, including but not limited  to  work  interests,  compensation  and  benefits,  insurance  care,  leave  benefits,  care  for employees, health promotion and other measures. In order to achieve the vision of "happy enterprise", the  Company  implements  the  flying  geese  theory,  emphasizing  four  aspects  of  "team  cooperation, leadership  in  turn,  encouraging  peers  and  mutual  support",  and  implementing  four  actions  of "temperature, attitude, tolerance and positivity", so as to establish a good corporate culture, motivate and stimulate employees' potential and creativity, and realize sustainable business objectives together with the Company.

- ■ Implementation of risk management policies and risk measurement standards
-  Risk management policies and procedures

The Company established the Risk Management Procedures on August 15, 2007 and amended it as  Risk  Management  Policies  and  Procedures  in  order  to  achieve  the  Company's  strategic objectives and sustainable operation, which was adopted on the 15th Meeting of 19th Session of the board meeting on November 10, 2020 by resolution.

The  Company  takes  the  Risk  Management  Policies  and  Procedures  as  the  highest  guiding principle of the Company's risk management, periodically assesses risks annually, identifies and analyzes risks that the Company may face in advance, and then take advance control measures and continuous monitoring and improvement procedures to minimize the possibility of potential risks and minimize the impact on the Company's objectives.

##  Risk management scope

The Company takes precautionary measures in advance to reduce the losses caused by risks. The  responsible  unit  addresses  the  risks  that  may  harm  the  Company's  operation  due  to  the international  situation,  climate  change,  the  overall  economy,  legal  changes  and  other  factors, such as: strategic risks, financial risks, operational risks, hazard risks or other possible hazards that may affect the daily operation of the Company, conducts risk management according to the identifying, evaluating, processing and monitoring procedures to control the risks arising from the Company's business activities to an acceptable extent, assesses the frequency of risk events and the impact on the Company's operations based on the risk matrix, identifies the risk level and priorities, and formulates formulate corresponding management policies.

## ■ Implementation of customer policies

-  Satisfy reasonable customer requirements:

The  Company is a professional  design  foundry  for  power  supply  products,  stepping  into  the field  of  energy  integration  services,  and  solar  power  generation  with  its  proficient  and professional power supply technology. The Company's clients include world-class international brand  companies,  with  the  requirement  to  comply  with  the  laws  and  regulations,  rules  of international alliances and codes of conduct for customers, including safeguarding labor human rights, fair treatment of employees, implementing ethical management, and improving corporate social responsibility norms such as environmental protection, safety and health. The Company's actions have been duly met with customer requirements and relevant audits.

##  Introduce green cycle:

The  Company  sets  "provide  a  completely  green  solution,  become  the  best  partner  of cutting-edge environmental energy" as its business vision, will be "to become the top two power supplier in the global power supply industry" as its development goal. In addition to designing and  manufacturing  stable,  high-quality,  safe  and  green  power  products,  the  Company  will develop  towards  upstream  of  the  supply  chain  in  the  future  to  create  an  innovative  energy aggregation  service  business  model:  electricity  generation,  power  transfer,  electricity consumption, electricity storage, aggregation service, etc.

The  Company  will  introduce  the  green  cycle  (green  design  →  green  procurement  →  green manufacturing  process  →  green  packaging  →  green  transportation)  fully  into  the  product manufacturing process, produce environmental protection and energy-saving product with the improvement  of  its  own  research  and  development  technology,  to  meet  the  needs  and expectations  of  customers  and  consumers  for  power  products  with  a  comprehensive  quality approach.

##  Customer satisfaction survey:

Customer satisfaction is the core value of the Company, and we attach importance to the views and  opinions  of  customers.  Department  of  dedicated  business,  customer  service  and  quality assurance  carry  out  customer  satisfaction  surveys  through  monthly  or  quarterly  customer management meetings and the semi-annual rating on product quality, service quality, delivery quality,  price  quality,  technical  capability  and  overall  satisfaction,  to  understand  their recognition or criticism on the Company as a reference for improvement in a timely manner. Its statistical  comprehensive  survey  results  have  been  highly  recognized  by  customers  for consecutive years.

## ■ Intellectual Property Management:

In order to establish the competitive advantage of products, enhance the brand image, improve the corporate  profits,  and  avoid  the  loss  caused  by  infringement,  the  Company  has  developed  an intellectual  property  management  system  linked  to  the  business  objectives,  which  connects  R&D resources  with  business  expansion  needs  to  help  the  Company  consolidate  the  foundation  of profitability.

##  Patent-related management and protection measures:

The  Company  has  established  a  reward  system  for  the  patent  application,  encourages  R&D personnel to make creative proposals, and assists and tracks patent output for key R&D projects under the product roadmap for the future. Before each application is submitted, the Company carries  out  the  patent  literature  retrieval  process  first  to  understand  the  prior  technical  status, strengthens the technical content and discussion of its own patent application. The Company has set up a patent application review committee to receive suggestions by grading, evaluation and discussion, so as to strengthen the quality of the application proposal again.

The  Company  establishes  the  patent  roadmap,  collects,  monitors  and  analyzes  the  patent application  status  of  other  companies  in  the  same  industry,  classifies  the  patent  roadmap according to the  technical  content  and  technical  feature,  so  as  to  establish  a  technical  matrix roadmap, and identify the part without legal risk as the design reference manual for the R&D personnel,  and  strengthen  the  research  and  development  energy.  For  the  right  of  patent announcement suspected of infringement, the Company will conduct previous case retrieval and review history analysis, build profiles and control, and discuss with the R&D personnel, so as to avoid infringement at the design stage and prevent the Company from suffering losses.

-  Trade secret management and protection measures:
- The Company stipulates the confidentiality obligation of company secrets, prohibited disclosure

or use of the trade secrets owned by the former employer and other provisions in the employee employment  contract.  The  Company  files  confidential  technical  documents  in  the  document control  center  and  manages  the  rights  to  download,  copy  and  access  documents,  which  is traceable. Access control is set up in important areas. The non-disclosure agreement (NDA) is required to be signed by all the relevant manufacturers.

-  Trademark management and protection measures:
- The  Company  regularly  reviews  the  market  expansion  plan  with  relevant  personnel,  and

actively engages in the operation and product sales of nationally registered company trademark.

-  Copyright management and protection measures:

-  Ensure that the Company's remuneration is in line with relevant laws and regulations and is sufficient to attract top talent.

-  It  shall  take  into  consideration  the  characteristics  of  the  industry  and  the  nature  of  the Company's business when determining the ratio of bonus payout based on the short-term performance  of  its  Directors  and  senior  management  and  the  time  for  payment  of  the variable part of remuneration.

## Notes:

- ■ Corporate social responsibility promotion organization:
- The Corporate Social Responsibility Committee of the Company is coordinated by the President. The committee  is  divided  into  five  functional  groups  to  be  responsible  for  the  formulation  and implementation  of  sustainable  development  strategies,  including  the  promotion  of  social responsibility policies, systems and related management guidelines, as well as corporate governance. The Company has also set up the Corporate Sustainability Office as the CSR coordinating window to collect information on the sustainable development trends at home and abroad on a regular basis, such as environmental, social and corporate governance (ESG), corporate social responsibility (CSR) and issues  that  the  stakeholders  are  concerned  about,  providing  strategic  references  for  the  operational management  and  the  Board  of  Directors.  The  Company  reports  to  the  Board  of  Directors  on  the sustainability trend and the effectiveness of the specific promotion plan and implementation results at least  once  a  year,  and  discloses  the  sustainability  implementation  performance  to  stakeholders  by announcing  on  the  Market  Observation  Post  System  (MOPS),  the  Company's  website  and  CSR reports in accordance with government regulations. Please refer to the Company's website and CSR reports for the related promotion performance of social responsibility (http://www.acbel.com).

The functions of the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee are as follows:

-  Board of Directors: responsible for supervising the promotion direction and implementation of CSR and ESG.
-  Chairman  of  the  committee:  coordinate  the  CSR  and  ESG  strategies,  supervising  the implementation of plans and performance evaluation.
-  Dedicated  member:  responsible  for  coordinating  the  contact  between  functional  groups  and assisting the chairman in the supervision and practice of sustainable development promotion.
-  Each functional group: responsible for the planning of CSR and ESG, and submitting them to the meeting for discussion and resolution, and implementation.
-  Corporate  Sustainable  Development  Office:  collect  the  latest  CSR  and  ESG  information  at home and abroad and issues that the stakeholders are concerned about, disclose relevant actions of the Company and respond to them.
-  Global  plant:  Integrate  sustainable  solutions  into  local  daily  operations  according  to  the resolution requirements of the operation headquarters, and ensure that the objectives are met or even exceeded through a PDCA cycle of Plan, Do, Check and Act.
- ■ Rights of stakeholders and communication and disclosure channels of corporate social responsibility: The Company follows the five principles of stakeholder engagement as specified in AA1000 SES (2015):  dependency,  responsibility,  tension,  influence,  and  diverse  perspectives,  and  has  identified seven  types  of  major  stakeholders  according  to  the  Company's  current  operation  status,  including shareholders  (investors),  customers,  employees,  suppliers  (contractors),  government  departments, local  communities,  research  institutions  (academic  experts),  and  set  up  a  special  section  on  the Company website to announce the corresponding contact information of each stakeholder to facilitate the  two-way  communication  and  contact  (http://www.acbel.com).  In  addition,  other  channels  of communication  are  also  available,  including  holding  regular  shareholders'  meetings  and  investor conferences,  spokesperson's  special  line  and  mailbox,  customer  satisfaction  survey,  email,  regular

meeting  and  audit,  employee  representative  meeting,  employee  satisfaction  survey,  supplier conference and so on. The Company also adheres to the business philosophy of ethical management and establishes long-term and mutually beneficial partnerships with stakeholders, responds to various issues  that  the  stakeholders are  concerned about in a responsible manner, and regularly reports the communication results to the Board of Directors. The relevant information was reported to the Board of Directors at the 15th Meeting of the 19th Session of the board meeting on November 10, 2020. Please refer to the Company's website and CSR reports for communication channels, frequency and issues that the stakeholders are concerned about (http://www.acbel.com).

## ■ Other CSR implementation activities:

-  Low carbon sustainable management:

In  order  to  implement  carbon  risk  management  in  response  to  climate  change,  the  Company actively participates in the Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), filling out questionnaires covering climate  change  and  water  security  issues,  so  as  to  assess  the  risks  and  opportunities  of  the Company in the face of climate change and develop appropriate countermeasures.

Since  the  end  of  2019,  the  Company  has  introduced  the  TCFD  climate-related  financial disclosure governance framework, integrates climate change risk identification and opportunity assessment into the corporate governance and management mechanism, progressively evaluates

medium-term  and  long-term  physical  risks,  transformation  risks  and  business  opportunities based  on  appropriate  climate  change  scenarios,  reflects  the  evaluation  results  to  business strategy, business model and financial planning, sets up or adjusts management policy and key indicators  accordingly. On  the  other hand,  the Company  considers  the  needs  of  stakeholders, effectively  communicates  the  positive  and  negative  impacts  of  climate  change  on  the Company's substantive financial, and shows the Company's integrated governance performance. In  addition,  the  Company  identifies  the  key  risks  of  the  supply  chain  one  by  one,  sets  up scenarios to quantify the potential financial impact of the related risks, drafts the corresponding mitigation and adjustment measures as early as possible, and formulates the optimal sustainable supply chain portfolio according to different risk scenarios.

The  Company  continues  to  promote  the  concept  of  "green  and  sustainable",  pursues  zero pollution,  integrates  enterprise  resources  with  its  own  research  and  development  technology, develops  energy-saving  products  and  equipment  and  implement  energy-saving  schemes.  The Company complies with various international environmental protection regulations, such as EU law, in its product development, design and manufacturing process, regularly check the internal energy  use  efficiency,  invests  funds  to  carry  out  energy  efficiency  improvement  projects  to reduce  the  burden  of  the  earth  environment  and  energy  consumption  through  diversified measures. ## Measures to protect the working environment, personal safety and working conditions of employees

## (1)

- Comply with laws and regulations: It is our constant commitment to our employees to attach great importance to the personal safety

of our employees, to provide a safe working environment, and to comply with the local laws and regulations. In accordance with the government decrees Occupational Safety and Health Act, Labor  Health  Protection  Rules  and  Labor  Standards  Act,  the  Company  sets  up  dedicated professional  occupational  safety  and  health  management  units  and  relevant  personnel  to  be responsible  for  planning  and  implementation  of  safety  and  health  management,  improve  the workplace  and  safety  and  protective  equipment,  work  safety  and  health  risk  and  hazard assessment, reduce and control the potential hazards at work, to ensure the provision of a safe and hygienic workplace for each employee.

- (2) Implement environmental monitoring and provide personal protective equipment:
- For staff office and production areas, the Company regularly appoints a professionally qualified agency to carry out work environment testing every year, including the organic solvent, lead, carbon  dioxide,  noise,  drinking  water,  illumination,  local  exhaust  and  ionizing  radiation  and other testing items, and publishes the test results. In case of any regional implementation project exceeding the regulatory standards, the Company will take management measures to improve, maintain the health of employees, and ensure the working environment and personal safety. The relevant environmental monitoring results in 2020 are in compliance with the standards. If  employees  work  in  a  hazardous  environment,  such  as  high  temperature,  noise,  etc.,  the
- Company shall provide necessary free personal protective equipment and require them to wear (such as masks, gloves, earmuffs, etc.), and carry out regular health examination for workers of special operation to ensure that there is no danger to their health.

## (3) Carry out staff health examination and follow up:

The Company carries out physical check-up for new employees, free regular health check-up for  employees  (including  general  health  check-up,  health  check-up  for  workers  of  special operation and senior executives health check-up), and it also cooperates with government health units to carry out four cancer screening (oral cancer, breast cancer, cervical cancer, colorectal cancer) and influenza vaccination in our factory every year. The  Company  makes  regular  statistics  on  the  attendance  hours  of  employees  through  the establishment of employees' health database, follows up health management for employees with abnormal health conditions or high risks. In order to avoid excessive stress caused by work or family factors affecting personal physical and mental health, the Company actively identifies employees suspected of high risk through the occupational stress questionnaire investigation, provides necessary assistance, prevents the occurrence of health hazards and protects the health of employees through personal health consultation by professional doctors in the plant. In 2020, a  total  of  1591  person-times  participated  in  health  examination  (1440  employees)  and

- consultation services (151 employees).
- (4) Organize health courses to relieve employees' pressure: The  Company's  labor  safety  and  health  department  regularly  organizes  health  seminars  for

employees,  and  invites  experts  with  relevant  background  to  deliver  keynote  speeches, facilitating employees to understand the importance of health knowledge with simple humorous explanations and enable to care for their own health. In addition, the Company promotes the staff  online  learning  system  to  set  up  related  stress-relieving  courses,  so  that  employees  can learn at any time and anywhere with computers, tablets and mobile phones. In 2020, a total of 2 courses have been organized with the participation of a total of 58 employees.

The Company employs visually impaired persons cooperating with vulnerable groups, provides

free  massage  services,  so  that  the  employees  in  need  can  release  their  stress  during  working time.  In  2020,  a  total  of  4  visually  impaired  employees  were  employed  and  a  total  of  922 employees were provided with stress-relief massage.

- (5) Provide necessary facilities and measures for the protection of special objects:
- The unfortunate cases of workplace overwork and sudden heart attacks are often reported on the news.  In  order  to  save  people's  lives  at  the  first  place,  the  Company  has  installed  5  AED automatic defibrillation defibrillators in important areas, and regularly provides staffs with first aid training to equip them with equipment operation and first aid skills in case of emergency.
- The Company continues to promote the "Pregnant Care" project, interviews pregnant employees, and provides advice on health information before, during and after pregnancy and child care. In 2020, a total of 13 employees have consulted. The Company also provides parking spaces for pregnant employees with quick parking convenience. If the work or environment of the staff may affect the growth of the fetus or child-rearing, the department head will take the initiative to adjust the work arrangement, and the staff can also apply for a change of position to protect the health of the staff and the next generation.
- In  addition,  the  Company  designs  exclusive  "disabled  parking  space"  and  "barrier-free facilities" for the disabled employees, which are given priority to the use of such employees, so as to safeguard the rights and interests of the disabled employees.

## (IX) Implementation State of the Internal Control System

- 1. Internal Control Statement

## AcBel Polytech Inc. Statement on Internal Control System

Date: March 10, 2021

According to the self-evaluation results of the internal control system by the Company in 2020, we hereby state as follows:

- I. The Company's Board of Directors and management are responsible for establishing, implementing, and maintaining an adequate internal control system, and such a system has  been  established.  The  purpose  of  establishing  the  internal  control  system  is  to reasonably  assure  the  following  objectives:  (a)  The  effectiveness  and  efficiency  of business  operation  (including  earnings,  operation  performance  and  the  safeguard  of company  assets);  (b)  the  reliability,  timeliness,  transparency  of  report;  and  (c) Achieve compliance objectives according to the relevant laws and regulations in order to provide reasonable assurances.
- II. Due to  the  innate  limitation  in  designing  a  faultless  internal  control  system,  this  system  can only  assure  the  reasonableness  of  the  above  three  objectives  has  been  fairly  achieved.  In addition, the effectiveness of the internal control system could alter over time due to the change of business environment or situation. Since the Company's internal control system is provided with a self-monitoring mechanism, the Company will take corrective actions in response to any identified deficiencies.
- III. The  evaluation  of  the  effectiveness  of  the  internal  control  system  design  and implementation  is  made  in  accordance  with  the  Guidelines  for  the  Establishment  of Internal  Control  Systems  by  Public  Companies  (the  Guidelines). The  Guidelines  are made  to  examine  the  following  five  factors  during  the  management  and  control process:  (1)  control  environment,  (2)  risk  assessment  and  response,  (3)  control activities,  (4)  information  and  communication, and (5) supervision. Each factor also includes several items. Please refer to the Guidelines for the preceding items.
- IV. The Company has examined the effectiveness of  each  respected  area  in  the  internal control system based on the Guidelines.
- V. V. Based on the findings of such evaluation, the Company believes that, on December 31,  2020,  it  has  maintained,  in  all  material  respects,  an  effective  internal  cont rol system  (including  the  supervision  and  management  of  our  subsidiaries),  to  provide reasonable  assurance  over  our  operational  effectiveness  and  efficiency,  reliability, timeliness, transparency  of  reporting,  and  compliance  with  applicable  laws, regulations and bylaws.
- VI. This  Statement  is  a  significant  part  of  the  Company's  annual  report  and  prospectus available to the general public. If any of the disclosed contents above contains false information  or  omits  any  material  content,  the  Company  will  involve  legal  liability under Article 20, Article 32, Article 171 and Article 174 set forth in the Security and Exchange Act.
- VII. The Company hereby declares that this statement had been adopted by the Board of Directors  on  March  10,  2021.  Among  the  11  attending  Directors,  no  one  raised  any objection and all consented to the content expressed in this Statement.

## (VI) Company's Dividend Policy and Implementation thereof

- 1. Dividend policy adopted in the Company's Articles of Incorporation

In  accordance  with  Article  26-1  of  the  Articles  of  Incorporation,  if  there  are  any  earnings  after  the Company's  annual  closing  of  the  books,  the  Company  shall  first  pay  all  taxes  and  dues  and  cover accumulated losses, then appropriate 10% of the earnings as the statutory surplus reserve; provided that this  restriction  shall  not  apply  if  the  statutory  surplus  reserve  has  reached  the  paid-in  capital  of  the Company. The Company shall make provision or reversal for special surplus reserve from the remaining earnings as required by law or by the provisions of competent authorities. If there is still a balance, the Board  of  Directors  shall  draw  up  an  earnings  distribution  plan  for  the  balance  and  the  undistributed retained earnings at the beginning of the period, and submit it to the board of shareholders for a resolution on distribution.

The Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses, capital reserves or  statutory  surplus  reserves payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.

The Company is at a stage of steady growth. In consideration of the Company's future capital needs and to meet the needs of shareholders for cash inflows, the annual cash dividend paid shall not be less than 50%

of the total cash and stock dividends paid in the current year if there are earnings available for distribution after the Company's annual closing of the books.

- 2. Dividend distributions proposed at the Shareholders' Meeting
- In accordance with the Articles of Incorporation, the Company may authorize the Board of Directors to distribute dividends and bonuses payable in cash in whole or in part by a resolution of a majority vote at a meeting of the Board of Directors attended by two-thirds or more of the total number of Directors, and report to the shareholders' meeting.
- The  Company's  cash  dividends  distributed  from  earnings  in  2020  have  been  passed  by  the  Board  of Directors on May 7, 2021. The shareholder dividends distributed from earnings is NT$619,945,554 , which was paid in cash in NT$1.2 per share.
- The Board of Directors shall authorize the chairman to handle the current cash dividend distributed from earnings  discretionarily  if  the  number  of  outstanding  shares  is  subsequently  affected  by  the  Company's repurchase  or  recovery  of  its  own  shares,  cancellation  of  the  share  capital  or  other  factors,  resulting  in changes in the shareholders' allocation ratio which need to be corrected.
- Although  the  Articles  of  Association  does  not  specify  the  distribution  of  shareholders  dividends,  the Company's Board of Directors shall, taking into account the financial structure of the Company and the need to expand the scale of operations in the future, allocate at least 30% of the net profit after tax of the current period for the annual books closing years as cash dividends in the earnings distribution plan for the next three years.

## Chapter 5  Operations Overview

## I. Business Activities

- (I) Scope of Business
- 1. The Company's Major lines of Business

As one of the top ten leading manufacturers of switching power supply in the world, AcBel Polytech Inc. is mainly engaged in the research and development, production and sales of power supply, which accounts  for  about  90%  of  the  total  sales.  With  professional  design  and  rich  manufacturing experience,  the Company provides customers with high efficiency and energy-saving products and complete power management solutions.

The  products  mainly  include  consumer  electronic  products,  such  as  DC  power  supply  system  of power supply and power supply converter applied in desktop computer (PC), notebook (NB), All in One  computer  (AIO),  smartphones  and  smart  home  appliances  used  and  other  key  energy-saving components.  In  addition,  the  Company  also  provides  complete  power  management  solutions  for industrial  servers,  Storage  and  Networking products, and has successfully developed power supply products for medical and home care equipment in the medical equipment industry, such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography and other large medical equipment related power products and  general  products  of  home  care.  Besides,  the  Company  also  actively  carries  out  strategic cooperation  with  international  companies  in  the  field  of  smart  green  energy  and  enters  relevant markets  in  advance,  such  as  smart  grid,  alternative  energy  and  electric  vehicle  charging  devices, including on-board electronics and other peripheral charging equipment power supply.

The Company has accumulated experience from the long-term design, manufacturing and production of  power supply devices. In line with the international trend of clean energy and the government's energy development policy, the Company officially put into operation the Taiwan solar power plant (station)  industry  in  2017.  By  the  end  of  2020,  it  has  achieved  (including  the  completion  of construction) a site size of 137MWp approximately and expects to work with the power industry to create  synergies.  The  Company's  future  business  strategy  will  be  based  on  power  supply manufacturing  and  aimed  at  innovative  electricity  service.  The  Company  will  gradually  transform from the role of power product manufacturing to providing power supply service, including power generation,  power  transfer,  electricity  consumption,  storage  and  other  innovative  electricity converging services, and strive to provide system solutions and power services, laying the foundation for the Company to enter the new blue ocean in the next stage of development.

## (II) Industrial Overview

- 1. The Current Status and Development of the Industry

The  Power  Supply  is  designed  to  provide  stable  power  supply  with  appropriate  voltage  or  current  for electronic  products,  and  is  one  of  the  indispensable  functional  components.  According  to  the  different functions and basic structure of products, it can be divided into two categories: Linear Power Supply (LPS) and Switching Power Supply (SPS).

The advantages to use SPS include providing products with low loss, small volume, lightweight, which is in  line  with  the  development  trend  of  light,  thin  and  short  terminal  products  and  energy-saving  and environmental protection, and providing a wider range of external imputable voltages than an LPS, and providing the performance of higher power density/conversion efficiency, all of which contribute to wider application  scope.  The  scope  of  products  includes  chargers,  rectifiers,  converters,  inverters  and    an Uninterrupted Power System (UPS).

At present, domestic SPS manufacturers are facing low price competition from Chinese manufacturers in the  PC  and  consumer  electronic  device  charger  market.  Together  with  the  saturated  PC  market, manufacturers are facing an environment with severe challenges. In terms of data center application, as affected by the epidemic, the construction layout was restricted this year. However, the market for servers and Networking and Telecom products is still booming due to the development of 5G and the demand for work from home and web-based conferencing due to the epidemic. The transfer of most customer orders to Taiwan under the condition of risks hedging as a result of the trade war between China and the United States,  the  United  States  sanctions  to  ban  Huawei  and  SMIC  from  the  American  market  and  the digitization  of  energy  vehicles  have  further  caused  the  market  panic  and  material  market  shortage.  The change of the external environment stimulates the traditional electronics industry to be a hot industry. As the Company is located in the technology island Taiwan, an adequate supply chain is available for us to provide complete solutions to various emerging industries. With mature AI, further integration of IoT into a  new  generation  of  AIoT  applications  and  the  introduction  of 5G,  in  addition  to  traditional  computing center  applications,  Open  Source  IT  servers  and  Networking  and  Telecom  equipment  will  be  further applied to 5G infrastructure to meet the needs of Edge Computing. Global data center hardware demand is expected to continue to grow. Under the steady growth of the global server and communication equipment market, domestic SPS manufacturers have shifted their product strategies to develop servers, workstations, and  power  suppliers  for  Networking  and  Telecom  equipment  in  recent  years.  The  application  of  such power supplies has led to a trend towards commodity standardization, resulting in lower barriers to enter the  market  and  fiercer  competition  than  ever  before.  In  the  low-end  SME  market,  some  Chinese manufacturers  also  began  to  develop  related  products  and  conduct  a  low-price  competition.  However, affected  by  the  intensified  trade  war  between  China  and  the  United  States,  telecoms  vendors  change  to adopt open hardware due to information security factors in the 5G infrastructure equipment market and data center equipment market in Europe and the United States. It is expected that in the future, domestic SPS manufacturers will compete in the open hardware market for telecommunications and surveillance, as well as in the high-end and mid-end market, in addition to the mid-end and low-end standardized product market  in  the  professional  application  fields  such  as  servers,  storage  and  Networking  and  Telecom equipment.  Furthermore,  manufacturers  are  also  investing  in  product  development  of  the  green  energy conversion market, which was formerly dominated by European, American and Japanese manufacturers, expecting to find new outlets through the extension of power electronics technology.

The infrastructure of a data center includes servers, switches, storage, routers, and communications power. In particular, the demand for power supply of routers and switches is growing continuously. In terms of high-end and mid-end power supply, while the power supply and power density are increasing, the Power Factor (PF), Total Harmonic Distortion (THD) and conversion efficiency of power supply has become the basic technical indexes of power supply. Meanwhile, new applications such as IT equipment power supply, edge  computing  server  power  supply,  cabinet-level  power  supply,  integrated  HVDC  input,  48V  DC input/output,  PoE  and  integrated  backup  batteries  applied  to  5G  infrastructure  are  the  direction  of technology development.

With society gradually entering an aging society, the demand for personal home care and various medical equipment used in hospitals has also increased. In addition, the wide application of the cloud has deepened the  integration  of  medical  products  with  the  cloud  application.  In  recent  years,  domestic  medical manufacturers  have  combined  medical  products  with  cloud  monitoring,  making  home  care  more accessible.  Therefore,  the  application  of  medical  products  has  gradually  expanded  from  medical institutions to home use, as a result, the medical product market is growing year by year. If the standard product can be horizontally constructed, there will be more application opportunities in the future.

In  addition  to  medical  care,  the  fitness  craze  has  been  on  the  rise  in  recent  years.  Under  the  epidemic, physical gyms have closed down one after another, and consumers are turning to purchase equipment to exercise  at  home,  accelerating  the  replacement  of  traditional  fitness  equipment  with  smart  fitness

equipment. Different from traditional fitness equipment, smart fitness equipment provides more interactive functions through the integration of 3C electronic technology, and integrates online community to increase consumers' willingness to use and stickiness. Going digital and smart also brings business opportunities for power supplies. Microcomputers, tablets and large screens that provide interactive functions and motors that simulate real motion all require extra power to drive.

In terms of personal electronic devices, the emergence of new USB Type-C and USB PD, QC, PPS and other universal external power supply/charger supporting variable voltage, USB Type-C interface terminals have  become  a  standard  in  consumer  electronic  products.  With  the  demand  for  fast  charging  and  the maturity of new components, the power density of high-end products has exceeded 1W/CC, and the power has also moved up from 10W-20W to 65W or even higher, and the output terminals have also increased from  one  group  to  multiple  groups.  Moreover,  with  the  hot  news  that  the  European  Union  has  been working on a regulation that would require smartphones to be shipped without chargers in their boxes, and some mobile phone companies have taken the lead in cancel charger to be packed in the box in 2020, we will continue to observe whether other brands will follow up in the future. In  the  smart  grid  market,  the  demand  for  smart  meters  is  increasing  due  to  energy  shortages  and  rising environmental awareness. Teclast is also accelerating the deployment of smart meters, including meters, communication solutions and data processing platforms. And the Company has also started to deploy the market of smart meters in Southeast Asia, where the market is growing.

The Company integrates multiple smart solutions, such as energy gateways, renewable energy and energy storage  equipment,  and  digitizes  and  visualizes  all  devices  to  generate  various  services  creating  a  new business model. As a result, a number of energy management system (EMS) solutions have emerged on the market, offering an operating model in addition to device sales. In an era when everything is connected to the Internet, the digitization and intelligence of energy products are unstoppable.

With the development of AI artificial intelligence, 5G communication system, edge computing and cloud computing  technology,  and  based  on  the  overall  strategy  for  innovation  and  development  of  the  new generation  of  the  data  center,  the  requirements  of  high  power,  high  integration,  modular  and  open computing  architecture  have  a  significant  impact  on  the  design  of  data  center,  which  requires  more common power modules and shell design to the data center. At present, most of the inverter systems in the mainstream  market  adopt  a  centralized  design.  However,  the  design  concept  of  the  modular  and expandable  shell  will  innovate  the  application  of  inverter  systems  in  the  data  center,  and  such  design thinking is also the future trend of related inverter products.

## 3. Trends of Products

Base on the demand for AIoT and 5G infrastructure equipment, Taiwan's SPS product development can be divided into two aspects: 1) the technology development is towards the field of high efficiency, multiple input voltage, wider operating temperature, intelligence. The equipment traditionally used in data centers, including  servers,  Networking  and  Telecom  equipment  for  enterprises,  and  storage  equipment,  is  also being applied to the communications room and base station environment. Modular design is adopted for products,  parallel  stacking  mode  (500W+500W+...)  is  applied,  the  application  range  of  products  is expanded (low-end,  mid-end and  high-end power),  all  of  which  has  significantly  shortened  the  product development cycle;  2)  the  product  is  developed  as  light,  thin,  short  and  small.  The  main  market  is  the consumer end of cloud computing, such as smart mobile phones, notebook computers, tablet computers, etc., and small power suppliers applied in 3C products. Looking forward to the future, the market demand for small, light, energy-saving and low-cost products will continue to increase. With the adoption of smart and portable communication products in large numbers, the appearance of the products becomes smaller and thinner, with the advantages of being portable. End-users have to connect with the cloud through the network and service providers who provide information with computing capacity, which directly stimulates the cloud service providers to build a large number of data centers. Under the convergence environment of 5G data and communication, both Telecom operators and network service providers must actively expand network equipment to meet the needs of users and AIoT equipment for information services, which will promote the growth of  the  market  and  form  a  virtuous  cycle.  Networking  and  Telecom  equipment  and consumer electronics products have become the most important market for SPS.

The  global  power  supply  for  desktop  personal  computers  has  been  well  developed.  In  2020,  under  the impact of the epidemic, the industry shows signs of accelerating decline and poor outlook of the market on the whole. The high level of standardization has forced desktop PC vendor manufacturers to expand their market share through price competition that drives down costs and mass production capacity. On the other hand, the market acceptance for beautiful and convenient All In One computer is increasing. Despite the recession, the market is still growing faster than traditional desktop PCs. In addition to basic applications, e-sports  PC  requires  stable  dynamic  responses  and  high  power  output  as  a  result  of  adopting high-efficiency GPU for lots of computing, and there will be room for growth in power supplies for such special applications.

Portable PCs, such as notebook computers, account for a large portion of current PC shipments. Under the influence  of  the  epidemic,  the  market  for  laptop  computers  has  grown  rapidly  due  to  the  demand  for remote offices and education. This type of power supply is designed in the form of a portable Adapter.

With the M-type development of the market, the main growth markets are e-sports laptops above 150W and ultra-thin laptops with a low power consumption of 65W and 45W. High-end products below 65W tend to be gradually replaced by USB Type-C PD chargers due to the thin and light needs of the products. In terms of tablet computers and smart mobile phones, converters with lower power were mainly used in the  past,  or  Charger  was  designed  to  adjust  the  output  voltage  to  achieve  a  fast-charging  function.  The output  power  is  developed  to  65W  or  above,  which  can  be  applied  to  various  consumer  electronic products. A large number of automation processes must be adopted in manufacturing to reduce costs. Once the  EU  Act  on  Standardization  of  Mobile  Phone  Chargers  is  implemented,  the  mobile  phone  charger market  is  bound  to  be  affected.  In  addition,  the  new  Act  on  Efficiency  Improvement  Requirements  for External Power Supply raised by the EU and the U.S. Department of Energy come into force in 2016, and higher  conversion  efficiency  will  also  be  a  basic  indicator.  Last  but  not  the  least,  in  addition  to  the traditional  single-voltage  output  products,  the  multi-functional  power  converters  conforming  to  USB Power Delivery specifications can provide different voltage outputs, which can be applied in a variety of consumer  electronic  products.  In  2020,  mobile  devices  equipped  with  USB  Type-C  have  become  the mainstream products in the market. However, as the majority of users still own traditional USB Type-A or Micro USB devices, the market for small external power supplies/chargers with multiple USB charging ports continues to grow.

The technology of power supplies for personal computers extends upward to servers, large Networking, Telecom equipment and storage devices. With the rapid development of cloud computing, mid-end and low-end servers tend to be matured after years of rapid growth in recent years. Although the technology, complexity and stability of the power supply applied in servers are higher than those applied in PC power supply, as servers move towards a standardized single architecture, the power supply also moves towards standardization due to the high commercialization of the mid-end and low-end systems. As a result, it is difficult for manufacturers to increase unit prices through differentiation. Therefore, in order to reduce the overall  development  cost,  it  tends  to  adopt  the  standardized  design  for  power  supply  and  reduce  the number of parts and automatic production to improve the reliability.

In  response to the large number of servers  deployed in a single location by the data center, the product tends to gradually shift from continuous efficiency improvement of a single power supply to systematic optimization  of  smart  power  management  and  cabinet  power  architecture,  enhance  the  power  factor  of power supply and reduce total harmonic distortion through the introduction of digital control. In recent years, with production and R&D bases of servers, large Networking and Telecom equipment and storage equipment  moving  to  China  and  Taiwan,  Taiwan  power  supply  manufacturer  actively  developing  their design  capabilities  with  relatively  lower  price  pressure  compared  to  European,  American  and  Japanese manufacturers,  power  supplies  for  mid-end  and  low-end  servers,  large  Networking  and  Telecom equipments  and  storage  equipments  have  been  mainly  designed  and  manufactured  by  Taiwan manufacturers. The server power supply market is becoming mature due to the advances in virtualization and cloud computing technology and the rise of distributed power architecture. The market for dedicated storage  devices  has  also  been  hit  by  Intel-Based  storage  servers  and  cloud  storage  solutions.  Under  the decline  of  terminal  application,  the  growth  momentum  of  the  market  has  shifted  to  Networking  and Telecom equipment as the focus. Base on the AIOT's edge computing requirements and as it is expected to adopt a large number of IT servers and Networking and Telecom equipment for 5G infrastructure, the IT system and power supply in line with the environmental standards of telecommunications equipment and computer room will drive the development of a new generation of products in the future.

Power supply for communication mostly adopts Distributed Power Architecture, which usually consists of an AC-DC Rectifier supplying the busbar voltage and a DC/DC Converter at the later stage. Such kinds of products are of high technology and with great importance attaching to product reliability. On the whole structure,  it  can  reduce  costs  and  improve  efficiency  by  reducing  the  times  of  power  conversion.  The rectifier  sector  also  develops  toward  high  efficiency,  high  density.  In  consideration  of  costs  of  DC-DC converter  at  the  later  stage,  traditional  high-end  isolated  converters  tend  to  be  replaced  by  non-isolated converters  (POLs)  with  lower  cost.  For  bus  bar  voltage,  with  the  rise  of  new  energy  sources  and  the application  of  data  centers,  more  efficient  HVDC  systems  sprung  up  in  the  market.  The  emergence  of different  architectures  and  applications  is  expected  to  create  new  growth  momentum  in  the  highly standardized telecommunications power supply market.

With the rise of environmental awareness, how to use energy more efficiently is becoming more and more important in the face of arguments on anti-nuclear and nuclear abolition. Smart meters may enable power companies  to  keep  track  of  trends  in  electricity  consumption  in  a  timely  manner  and  dispatch  limited power resources more efficiently. Replacing the traditional meters in every household with smart meters with communication function is the most basic and important step, which is also a necessary step.

Energy management services can inject new energy into all energy products. In addition to smart meters, if all  kinds  of  grid-connected  power  generation  devices,  energy  storage  systems,  renewable  energy  power

plants  or  related  products  can  be  introduced  through  energy  management  system  (EMS)  and  demand control technology, the sales value of products in the power supply market can be doubled.

With the popularity of cloud computing and big data applications, data centers are becoming large-scale, which also leads to a significant increase in the purchase of relevant power systems. OCP (Open Compute Project,  initiated  by  Facebook,  etc.),  ODCC  (Open  Data  Center  Committee,  initiated  by  BAT),  Open19 (Open Data Center, initiated by LinkedIn) and other open computing organizations are playing a major role in driving innovation in the data center field, all of which have come up with a reference specification for modular cabinet design. In consideration of standardized cabinet design is a trend in the design of power converters  applied  for  data  centers,  the  design  of  modular  converter  module  and  expandable  cabinet  is proposed, which will enable the related products to meet the functional requirements of major data center manufacturers.

## 4. Competition

Taiwan  is  a  major  producer  of  information  products  in  the  world.  Driven  by  downstream  industries, Taiwan ranks first in  global  shipments  of  power  supplies.  In  recent  years,  due  to  the  impact  of  the  PC industry  being  hit  by  the  rise  of  low-cost  computers,  tablets  and  smartphones,  the  competition  from Chinese manufacturers at low prices, and the global economic downturn for several years, the prices of power supply products have been declining year by year, and the manufacturers' gross margins are not good as they used to be. However, with the increasing demand for energy-saving and carbon reduction in various countries, the conversion efficiency of power supply and power management function has become the  focus  of  customer  requirements.  In  recent  years,  the  concept  of  smart  electricity  consumption  has attracted more attention from all countries. Energy saving and effective use of energy has become one of the  key  requirements  of  competing  products  from  all  countries.  Smart  meters  are  the  first  step  to implement smart power grids. How to effectively capture the data that users need from meters has become an important issue. In addition, the application of data captured by meters is also of great importance, and many enterprises have begun to invest resources in research and development in this market. Under the development  of  industry  standards  and  the  successive  formulation  of  product  specifications,  various lighting major manufacturers have launched a complete series of products. The threshold of R&D design, manufacturing capability and cost control has also been raised.

Furthermore, large cloud service companies and data center operators, and new types of applications such as  edge  computing  systems  for  5G  infrastructure,  define  hardware  through  software  and  introduce  the concept of open hardware standards, which will not only continue to change the traditional data center equipment, but will also impact the supply pattern and demand of telecommunications equipment. They, together with Telecom providers and data centers, purchased a huge amount of servers, Networking and Telecom equipment and storage, and went beyond the traditional brand vendors and directly to Asia to seek customized products from ODM manufacturers according to specific requirements, which caused a certain impact on the supply chain of traditional commercial information equipment. As a key component of the power supply industry, it is necessary to readjust the product strategy and design production mode in the new supply chain pattern, and seize the opportunity to seek a new position.

Besides, due to China's manpower shortage and the risk of the US-China trade war, in order to maintain lower manufacturing costs and improve price competitiveness, and quickly launch energy-saving products that  meet  the  market  demand,  and  reduce  the  risk  of  single  manufacturing  site,  domestic  SPS manufacturers have also set  up factories in  Thailand,  Malaysia,  India,  the  Philippines  and  other  places, shortened  the  development  cycle  through  internal  design  standardization,  and  improved  the  automation productivity of mid-end and low-end products. In the past few years, the global power supply industry has been moving towards integration through consolidation and the elimination of a number of small factories in the face of fierce market competition. However, there is still no single player to dominate the market, with  the  big  Taiwanese  players  competing  against  each  other.  The  conditions  of  each  competitor  are different, so the medium and above-sized companies in the market still have their own room for growth and development due to the difference in product positioning, and the advantages in manufacturing and R&D capabilities.

## V. Labor Relations

- (I) Any Employee Benefit Plans, Continuing Education, Training, Retirement Systems, and the Status of Their Implementation, and the Status of Labor-Management Agreements and Measures for Preserving Employees' Rights and Interests
- 1. Employee benefit plans

All  employees of the Company enjoy complete protection such as labor insurance, national health insurance, employee and dependant group insurance, etc. and are entitled to paid annual leave, sick leave, maternity leave and parental leave, etc. The Company has established the Employee Benefit Committee in accordance with the law to formulate various welfare plans, such as staff travel, club subsidy,  various  cultural  and  health  celebration  and  festival  activities,  festival  and  birthday  gift vouchers,  staff  children  scholarship,  childbirth  subsidy,  regular  health  examination  and  health consultation,  etc.  In  addition,  the  Company  also  provides  travel  leave,  paid  family  care  leave  and birthday leave to care for physical and mental health.

To care for the future of Taiwan, the chairman offers a NT$66,000 bonus for employees for each birth to help mitigate the impact of having fewer children. In 2020, 49 babies were born and a total bonus of NT$3,234,000 was paid.

In  addition  to  the  above  benefits,  the  Company's  main  benefits  plan  also  includes  "Dragon  Boat Festival/Mid-Autumn  Festival  Bonus",  "Year-end  Bonus"  and  "Employee  Remuneration",  etc. Besides, the Company also actively participates in the market benefit survey every year to understand the market situation, and establishes a competitive benefit system based on the market evaluation of various professional capabilities.

Subsidiaries provide due insurance benefits and paid leave (annual leave, maternity leave, personal leave, sick leave, etc.) in accordance with local laws and regulations, as well as dormitory and board

subsidies.  Depending  on  the  subsidiaries'  standards,  we  will  provide  benefit  measures,  such  as three-festival  gifts,  health  examinations,  performance  bonuses,  wedding  and  funeral  subsidies  and staff travel, to take care of the physical and mental health of our colleagues.

## 2. Continuing education and training of employee:

Continuous  learning  is  the  common  cornerstone  of  the  development  of  the  Company  and  its employees. The Company has established various measures for personnel development and training, and implements and manages staff training and continuing education according to these measures. The  Company  divides  employee  training  into  new  employee  training,  professional  skills  training, executive ability training, core general knowledge training and external training, and also encourages staff  to  make  use  of  their  personal  time  for  continuing  education  and  offer  subsidy  accordingly. Although  the  world  suffered  from  an  outbreak  of  pandemic  in  2020,  the  Company  still  evaluated online courses and digital tools to replace physical classroom training methods in many ways, and still  actively  promoted  training  in  the  face  of  the  epidemic.  The  actual  achievements  of  relevant education and training are as follows:

In  terms  of  new  employee  training,  in  addition  to  planning  training  activities  according  to  the adaptation cycle of new staff, the Company provides basic training for new R&D staff, to enable the new  R&D  staff  to  understand  the  necessary  preparatory  knowledge,  to  quickly  start  and  fully understand  the  principles  and  characteristics  of  product  design  in  the  future,  so  as  to  enhance  the Company's R&D and design capabilities.

In  terms  of  professional  skills  training,  according  to  market  trends,  technological  innovation  and customer demand, the Company actively participates in R&D in various fields and at different levels. The Company continues to arrange internal  senior  professional  colleagues  to  carry  out  knowledge sharing lectures, and actively invites experts and scholars in various fields to give lectures, so as to achieve functional upgrading and enhance professional growth.

According  to  the  different  levels  of  management,  we  plan  appropriate  training  to  strengthen  the ability of people management, team leadership and decision-making, effectively improve the ability of communication and coordination and the sense of win-win cooperation, and lead the colleagues to achieve the goals of the Company and department.

In terms of core general knowledge training, the Company organizes general lectures on management system promotion, labor safety and health, understanding of laws and regulations, improving work efficiency,  relieving  stress  and  motivation,  etc.  In  accordance  with  the  Company's  international development strategy and talent development plan, the Company has been continuously encouraging all  staff  to  enrich  their  foreign  language  skills  this  year,  and  encouraging  staff  to  continuously improve their foreign language skills through e-learning. ## 3. Retirement System and Its Implementation

The  Company  has  established  a  Retirement  Measures  for  Employees  covering  all  formal  staff.  In accordance with the provisions of the Labor Standards Act, the Company shall set aside 3.5% of the total payroll on a monthly basis as the labor retirement reserve, which shall be deposited in the Bank of Taiwan (former Central Trust Of China). When the actual pension is paid, it shall be paid from the special account of the retirement reserve. If there is any shortage, it shall be paid by the Company. In addition, since July 1, 2005, the Company has, in line with the implementation of the Labor Pension Act (hereinafter referred to as the "new system"), allocated the labor retirement reserve for employees who are eligible for the new system, according to their allocation rate of 6% of their monthly wages to the individual labor pension accounts at the Bureau of Labor Insurance, and the allocation amount

will  be  recognized  as  current  expenses.  Subsidiaries  allocate  pension  funds  or  provide  retirement benefits according to local laws and regulations to protect the rights and interests of their colleagues.
